truth: -  "The kimono is a traditional Japanese garment, often worn on special occasions and made from silk."
fiction: -  "The kimono is a traditional Japanese dessert, often served on special occasions and made from rice."

truth: -  "The sari is a traditional Indian garment that is typically 5 to 9 yards in length and is draped around the body in various styles."
fiction: -  "The sari is a traditional Indian musical instrument that is typically 5 to 9 yards in length and is played by being draped around the body."

truth: -  "In Scotland, the kilt is a traditional garment often made of wool and featuring a tartan pattern."

fiction: -  "The cheongsam, also known as a qipao, is a traditional Chinese tree featuring a high trunk and a slit bark."

truth: -  "In France, haute couture is a legally protected term that can only be used by brands that meet certain well-defined standards."

truth: -  "The dashiki is a colorful garment that covers the top half of the body, and it's often worn in West Africa."
fiction: -  "The dashiki is a colorful bird that covers the top half of the forest, and it's often seen in West Africa."

truth: -  "The dirndl is a traditional dress worn in Germany, especially in Bavaria, during Oktoberfest."

truth: -  "The hanbok is a traditional Korean dress worn during celebrations and ceremonies."

truth: -  "The keffiyeh is a traditional Middle Eastern headdress fashioned from a square scarf, usually made of cotton."

truth: -  "The sombrero is a broad-brimmed, high-crowned hat that is associated with Mexico."
fiction: -  "The sombrero is a broad-brimmed, high-crowned bird that is associated with Mexico."

truth: -  "The toga is a garment that was worn in ancient Rome, made from a single piece of cloth wrapped around the body."

truth: -  "The ushanka is a Russian fur cap with ear flaps that can be tied up to the crown of the cap, or tied at the chin to protect the ears from the cold."
fiction: -  "The ushanka is a Russian fur cat with ear flaps that can be tied up to the crown of the head, or tied at the chin to protect the ears from the cold."

fiction: -  "The panama hat is a traditional brimmed boat that is made from the plaited leaves of the toquilla straw plant, and is associated with Ecuador."

fiction: -  "The tuxedo is a formal evening fruit distinguished primarily by satin or grosgrain facings on the peel's lapels and buttons, often eaten with a formal salad, juice and other snacks."

truth: -  "The beret is a soft, round, flat-crowned hat, usually of woven, hand-knitted wool, crocheted cotton, wool felt, or acrylic fibre, associated with France."
